content:
"Dizzy reece, “soundin’ off.” First van gelder mono, factory sealed and vinyl. My friend neil would go crazy over this. So? You can’t find these, I’m tellin’ ya." said by Jack
"This must be our lucky night." said by Diane
"Oh, in more ways than one. Thank you for suggesting mo’S." said by Jack
"Well, it’s your favorite record store, and tonight, we’re going to do all of our favorite things." said by Diane
"Everything I do with you is my new favorite thing." said by Jack
"Nope! Already forgotten because this night is not over." said by Diane
"Oh, other plans?" said by Jack
"Yes. Drinks first." said by Diane
"Oh! Well, let me get you something at the bar, all right?" said by Jack
"No, no, no! No, no. No, no. I got this. Two martinis, one dirty, one with extra olives, and I can’t wait to chat up the bartender or mixologist or whatever he wants to be called, because I am dying for small talk with strangers. Like, what kind of gin does he prefer, and how we both know that it should be stirred, not shaken because gin is so much more delicate than vodka." said by Diane
"You are an absolute wonder." said by Jack
"Hmm. I’ve just gotten my life back for the second time since coming home to genoa city and I plan on soaking up every minute of it." said by Diane
"Oh my, god, mom, you’ve got to let this go." said by Summer
"Hey." said by Kyle
"Oh. Wow, that looks… festive?" said by Summer
"Yeah. I want it to be perfectly chill by the time my parents get home. We can finally toast to my mom’s freedom." said by Kyle
"Hey. Summer, I’m getting desperate. Please, please, answer me." said by Phyllis
"Well, we cut the drop off pretty close. I’m glad you made it to your gate in time. I love you, too, luce. You have a safe flight. Oh, um, and… text me when you land. I don’t care what time it is, okay? ‘Kay. Bye." said by Daniel
"You’re right, nikki. Cameron started causing problems for me the minute he got to town. He… wanted me. And he made it evident that if his deal was gonna happen with nicholas, I was gonna have to chip in a little on the side." said by Sharon
"And you never told your husband about this ugly game this guy was playing with you?" said by Nikki
"How could I tell him?" said by Sharon
"How could you not? This guy was comin’ after you. Do you think for a moment that nicholas wouldn’t have supported you?" said by Nikki
"Oh, my god. Oh, it’s you." said by Sharon
"Sorry. You okay?" said by Nick
"Yeah, I’m just a little jumpy." said by Sharon
"Yeah, you need to start locking the doors, sharon." said by Nick
"Good idea." said by Sharon
"All right, if you’re done here, let’s go. I’ll take you home." said by Nick
"You don’t have to drive me." said by Sharon
"Sorry. You don’t get a say in that." said by Nick
"Well, you already beefed up security." said by Sharon
"Well, you can never be too safe. And until kirsten is out of our lives, you’re gonna have to deal with it." said by Nick
"You know, every time I hear a noise or I get a delivery, or my phone rings, I’m afraid. I know, it’s silly." said by Sharon
"No. It’s not silly at all. Not with a monster like that on the loose." said by Nick
"Not bad. Not bad at all. I won’t let me moderate to severe plaque psoriasis" said by Cameron
"Additional sponsorship provided by…" said by Announcer
"Here you go." said by Diane
"Oh." said by Jack
"The reason there’s an odd number of olives is because an even number is bad luck." said by Diane
"Well, I think luck’s gotta be a big part of our evening." said by Jack
"Mmm." said by Diane
"So, um… where’s your drink?" said by Jack
"In all the excitement of interacting with the outside world, I forgot my martini." said by Diane
"Kyle is forever forgetting his phone these days. I hope it isn’t inherited." said by Jack
"I would hate to think I passed down that trait." said by Diane
"Now, wait a minute. Where’d you just go now?" said by Jack
"It’s– it’s nothing. I was just thinking that the night of the gala, kyle lost his phone in here, and that set off the whole chain of events that became a nightmare." said by Diane
"I’m sorry, I did not mean to bring all that up. That is over now. Good fortune is on our side from here on out." said by Jack
"And, I– I know, and I– I– I do feel fortunate. But jack, I just worry about what this has done to kyle and summer. I mean, I– I watch them, I listen, and they don’t seem to be connected. It’s like they’re living separate lives." said by Diane
"None of this has been easy for either of them. None of this has been easy for us. What with phyllis alive, and you out from under these charges, I’m hoping that life can get back to some semblance of normal. All of the stress will start to slowly go away and that will be better for everyone. Summer and kyle included. And we will be there for them, but until then, tonight, this is about you. About your courage, about your strength. It’s a celebration of you. So, where do we go now?" said by Jack
"I think I’m going back to the bar to get my drink. I’ll be right back." said by Diane
"Oh, hey!" said by Summer
"Hey." said by Kyle
"Let me help you with that. I was about to come find you." said by Summer
"Yeah. Harrison and the nanny are out catching fireflies by the pool house." said by Kyle
"Mmm." said by Summer
"So nice seeing him excited and carefree and laughing. It’s almost as if the kid notices a burden has been lifted off of this house. Oh, uh, look, I’m sorry. I know it must be hard for you, celebrating a homecoming of sorts, knowing your mother’s still out there." said by Kyle
"I need to go out." said by Summer
"Again?" said by Kyle
"Yeah, I need to talk to daniel." said by Summer
"Okay, can’t it wait ’til morning?" said by Kyle
"No, he just dropped off lucy at the airport, so he’s got time right now." said by Summer
"Summer, it’s late. My parents will be home soon." said by Kyle
"Look, things have been a mess between me and daniel. I mean, you’ve seen it. We’re so angry at each other and I know that my mom would hate that, so I just feel like while we’re waiting to see her, it’s– it’s one of the only things that we can do, is clear up the animosity between us. I mean, you can understand that, right?" said by Summer
"Look, I’m all for you resolving your issues with daniel." said by Kyle
"I’m sorry, I know that I’ve hurt you. The way that I’ve shut down and shut you out, and… I really am so sorry, I know… I believe that you’re on my side, even if I don’t deserve it." said by Summer
"Why would you say that? Of course you do." said by Kyle
"I love you." said by Summer
"I love you, too. And I will always be on your side. And I will be waiting here when you get back. Unless you want me to come with you." said by Kyle
"No! Uh… I mean you should– you should stay here and celebrate with your folks. I mean, your family is healing, and the least I can do is try to do the same for mine." said by Summer
"I’m sure you have enough going on without babysitting me. You missed all those calls from sally. Is she okay?" said by Sharon
"Yeah, uh… news isn’t great. Apparently, sally’s at risk for pre-eclampsia." said by Nick
"Nick, that’s serious." said by Sharon
"I know. So she’s gonna scale back her work, and, uh, try and take it easy. A lot more rest. Get on the meds, and uh… lot of monitoring." said by Nick
"Maybe you should go and be with her right now." said by Sharon
"Ah, she’s home. She’s safe now. I’ll feel a lot better when I get you home. You know, with cameron kirsten on the loose, we all have to be on defcon one right now." said by Nick
"Still can’t believe he approached faith, and it’s totally my fault." said by Sharon
"Why would you say that?" said by Nick
"Because when cameron delivered that cigar box to the front porch, faith was there. I could have warned her, right then, what was going on, to be careful. Maybe then, she would have run the other direction when cameron approached her in the park. I thought that I was protecting her. I was… leaving her to be vulnerable." said by Sharon
"Well, she knows now." said by Nick
"I told her about everything that happened with cameron after you and chance left." said by Sharon
"Well, I’m sure that wasn’t easy, but faith needed to know. She needed the truth. We all have to have our eyes wide open right now." said by Nick
"Every time I open the door, I’m afraid I’m gonna run into another one of cameron’s sick gifts. And I have a feeling his head games are just getting started." said by Sharon
"Thank you." said by Diane
"Shouldn’t leave your drink unattended like that." said by Cameron
"Excuse me?" said by Diane
"Your martini. It’s been sitting there for a while. You shouldn’t do that. Any kind of creep could come along, drop something in it. No one would notice. You got no idea what some people will do." said by Cameron
"I think it’s okay." said by Diane
"Just saying. You can’t trust anybody." said by Cameron
"Well, I– I think I can trust anyone here. I come here all the time, with– with my husband, and between the two of us, we know everyone in this room." said by

"Now that we’ve broken ground on the semiconductor plant in hai phong, I would love to end our relationship with our partners in shanghai. They’re more focused on performance instead of security. And I think that’s a mistake given the current market changes." said by Victoria
"I thought you might feel that way. I already have the contract under review, so we can consider our options." said by Nikki
"Oh, of course, you have." said by Victoria
"We’re right where we need to be. We expect to close next week." said by Nikki
"Mom, why are you staring at me? Something wrong?" said by Victoria
"I’m just wondering what’s giving you that glow?" said by Nikki
"I would’ve preferred to do this in my office." said by Audra
"Too many ears. And this news is only for you." said by Nate
"Harrison would be all over this camp maradona." said by Kyle
"Isn’t that a soccer camp? Don’t you think he’s a little young for that?" said by Summer
"Our boy loves the game." said by Kyle
"He likes to kick a ball and run after it." said by Summer
"That is the whole game." said by Kyle
"I was thinking camp wildwind. All that nature, he can play soccer during the school year. I mean, a– a day camp like that would be more of an adventure for him." said by Summer
"Okay. Well, we need to make a decision, like, now, so, fine. Whatever you want." said by Kyle
"All right. What do you think, a half day, full day?" said by Summer
"Let’s start with a half day." said by Kyle
"That’s what I was thinking." said by Summer
"Great. Problem solved." said by Kyle
"Hey. I’m sorry." said by Summer
"Your audacity is beyond belief." said by Jack
"Jack, I don’t want any trouble. I just don’t like your tone." said by Tucker
"Whatever is going on between me and my sister is none of your concern. Where is she?" said by Jack
"Whatever it is you’re angry about with her, you need to remember that she always has your best interest at heart." said by Tucker
"Yeah. Well, not this time. Where is she?" said by Jack
"If you’re planning on making her life difficult, I guarantee you, I will make your life a living hell." said by Tucker
"Oh, now you’re threatening me in my own home?" said by Jack
"Our home." said by Tucker
"Not if I throw you out on your pompous ass." said by Jack
"Hey, what is going on? I could hear you outside." said by Ashley
"Your, whatever he is, is determined to insert himself in something that is none of his business." said by Jack
"Okay, jack, you’re the one who’s shouting. So, maybe you need to just back off. Even when I was with the people I love," said by Ashley
"Am I? I’m– I’m glowing? Well, it must have, um– it must have been the oxygen facial that I got yesterday." said by Victoria
"Hmm, no. It’s much deeper than that. You’re radiant. There’s an energy, like the air around you is crackling." said by Nikki
"Mom, if you’re insinuating something about nate, again–" said by Victoria
"It was merely an observation." said by Nikki
"All right. Duly noted. Can we get back to work now?" said by Victoria
"It’s the kind of energy you get when you go for the kill and you win." said by Nikki
"Yes. I love when newman has a big win." said by Victoria
"I hear elena dawson stormed out of here. Was that your big victory?" said by Nikki
"Oh, there it is. Why didn’t you just lead with that, mom? And no, elena and I did not get into some knock-down, drag-out over nate. To be perfectly honest, she did not play the victim. She let nate and I know exactly what she thinks of us, and she broke her contract, which I am more than happy to let her do." said by Victoria
"Oh. Well, I’m glad it didn’t get too ugly." said by Nikki
"Mom, you have been very vocal about your disapproval of me and nate and how we got together. I’m not proud that we hurt elena. I’m noT. I– it weighs on me. The guilt, the sneaking around. I’m glad that she knows about it now so that she can move on and have time to heal. And now nate and I can– we can live our relationship out in the open. And yes. Yes, it feels wonderful." said by Victoria
"So, your glow is about nate." said by Nikki
"Yes, it’s about nate. He’s a real part of my life now. And you and dad and nick, you need to learn how to accept it." said by Victoria
"What are you sorry for?" said by Kyle
"This tension between us. I hate it. And it’s all my fault." said by Summer
"I’ve been worried about you. The distance between us, I feel like I’m losing a little bit more of you every day." said by Kyle
"You have done nothing but love me and I’ve treated you horribly. I’ve just been so furious at diane and… that’s spilled over to you. I was looking for answers to my mom’s death, and I thought that you were in denial. So, I shut you out to protect myself, to punish you. I don’t know, but it was wrong. And kyle, I’m– I’m so sorry." said by Summer
"Not gonna lie, I felt like the enemy. It hurts, but I know you were hurting more. Your grief and anger. Summer, your mom is alive. You can let go of that pain now." said by Kyle
"How do I do that? I know that my mom is… supposedly alive, but… that grief, it’s just turned into terror. I don’t know where she is. I don’t know if she’s okay. And if the police, they go looking for her and they find her… or what if they don’t?" said by Summer
"Hey, hey. Come here. I know what will help. Seeing your mom with your own two eyes, that she’s not only alive, but that she’s home and safe where she belongs. I promise I will make that happen." said by Kyle
"Of course, you take tucker’s side. You don’t even know what’s going on here." said by Jack
"Why don’t you tell me what’s going on?" said by Ashley
"Actually, let’s you and I grab a drink somewhere–" said by Tucker
"I got a better idea. Why don’t you go grab a drink? Ashley isn’t going anywhere ’till we hash this out." said by Jack
"I don’t like the way you’re talking to me. Now stop it. What’s happening?" said by Ashley
"Would you excuse us, please?" said by Jack
"No, I’m good." said by Tucker
"Out with it." said by Ashley
"Okay. I won’t even ask if you were trying to stage a coup at jabot. I already know the answer." said by Jack
"I’m shocked it took billy so long to talk to you, frankly." said by Ashley
"Oh, you are hereby on notice. If you have any intention of following through with your plans, you will fail miserably. You will have no standing. You will lose all credibility. Your reputation will be trashed." said by Jack
"A coup?" said by Tucker
"Oh, yeah, like he’s not part of it. Ashley found jabot documents in your hotel room back when she knew who our real enemies were." said by Jack
"You know very well tucker has nothing to do with this. The only enemy our family has is your fiancéE." said by Ashley
"You leave diane out of this." said by Jack
"It’s impossible. All roads lead back to diane." said by Ashley
"This is about your anger." said by Jack
"No, it’s about me trying to protect our family’s legacy, jack." said by Ashley
"This is about your efforts to try to bring diane down." said by Jack
"I will not let our company and our family be diane’s latest casualties. And that’s what’s gonna happen if you don’t wake up." said by Ashley
"The only threat to this family right now is you." said by Jack
"She’s gonna drag us all down, jack. I’m not gonna let it happen." said by Ashley
"No more. This has to stop. She found it." said by Diane
"You look like you could use a drink." said by Audra
"Not a bad idea." said by Nate
"What’s going on?" said by Audra
"Elena showed up at victoria’s office while I was there. That’s what’s going on." said by Nate
"Yeah. I thought that’s where she might be headed. Um, I ran into her at crimson lights. She was locked and loaded." said by Audra
"And you sent her in our direction?" said by Nate
"No, I just listened." said by Audra
"Well, she ripped into victoria and me and quit the podcast." said by Nate
"All wrapped in her self-righteous, wronged-woman fury. You know some people will never understand how the world works." said by Audra
"I do feel bad about how it all went down, audra." said by Nate
"Okay, it’s over, nate. Stop beating yourself up." said by Audra
"Ah, it’s hard not to feel guilty. And it didn’t help that devon ran into me and he piled on." said by Nate
"I mean, you do know that when you screw people over, you don’t get to feel sorry for yourself when they dump on you." said by

"I won’t try to talk you out of whatever you’re planning to persuade adam to rejoin the family. He’s your son, you love him, and that’s all there is to it." said by Nikki
"Good. I’m glad you see it that way." said by Victor
"However, I would like you to consider a few things." said by Nikki
"I’m listening." said by Victor
"Right now, everything is peaceful, for the most part." said by Nikki
"Right." said by Victor
"Nicholas and victoria are in a good place again. The company is running well. It is thriving. Now, you put adam into that mix, and that lovely equilibrium will go right out the window." said by Nikki
"Well, not necessarily." said by Victor
"Especially if he doesn’t come back for the reason that nicholas did. Nicholas felt it was the right thing to do. He wanted to be in a position to support his family, not because you were pulling strings behind the scenes." said by Nikki
"My darling, I appreciate your thoughts." said by Victor
"Yes, but you’re going to ignore them, anyway." said by Nikki
"No, no, no, I didn’t say that. It’s always important to me to hear what you have to say. Okay? You know that." said by Victor
"Well, I’m not going to tell you how to handle this. I just want to reiterate that I don’t see this scenario ending the way you do. What if adam likes his life the way it is? What about when he finds out that you are manipulating his downfall? He may never have anything to do with you again." said by Nikki
"My baby, I hear what you’re saying, but I want to assure you that… I know my son, and I have the situation well in hand." said by Victor
"I’m compiling information before the jabot board meets in february. Would you have some time this afternoon to pull some things together for me? Excellent. Please bring me the most recent status reports for all the accounts adam newman has been overseeing. Yes. All of them." said by Kyle
"So, uh, now that it’s just the two of us again, is there anything that you want to tell me?" said by Victoria
"You’re just not gonna let it go, are you?" said by Nick
"I just felt like there was something that maybe you wanted to share before tucker interrupted us." said by Victoria
"You mean before you invited him over here to toy with him and mess with his mind?" said by Nick
"Well, I have to admit, it was fun turning the tables on him and watching him squirm for a change." said by Victoria
"I highly doubt tucker is used to being the entertainment for his competitors." said by Nick
"Mm-hmm. I’m sure that he’s not. You’re trying very hard to change the subject, which makes me more determined to find out what’s wrong with you. And don’t say nothing because I know better. So whatever it is, spill. I won’t say a word to anyone. I promise." said by Victoria
"I already told you. It’S…dad." said by Nick
"I know. You said it was business. And I’m not buying that. So what’s the real story?" said by Victoria
"Alright. I’m sick and tired of the way he keeps tearing down sally and pressuring me to end our relationship. Uh… you know, it’s, uh… he just dismisses it, and I’m tired of it, you know? And I just want to know when it’s gonna end." said by Nick
"Is that a serious question? Come on. Dad is always going to feel the need to control our lives. Not that I condone it, of course. Look, to be honest with you, I don’t really see a future for you and sally. You are — you’re just too good for her, nicholas." said by Victoria
"Vick —" said by Nick
"You’re so far out of her league, it isn’t even funny." said by Victoria
"I don’t need this from you, either, okay?" said by Nick
"Why do I get the feeling that there’s something else you’re not telling me?" said by Victoria
"My head is still in the clouds after last night. I mean, I can’t believe fen flew in to watch me accept my award." said by Lauren
"I know what you mean. And finally meeting trey." said by Michael
"Wasn’t he the sweetest?" said by Lauren
"They make a great couple." said by Michael
"It’s so touching watching them in love and… even more amazing that our son is happy and healthy and excited for the future." said by Lauren
"Yeah, their happiness is infectious." said by Michael
"It is. Oh, there’s phyllis." said by Lauren
"Hey, phyllis." said by Michael
"Hi!" said by Lauren
"Hi! Hi. I didn’t know I’d run into you two." said by Phyllis
"Well, now that you do, please join us." said by Lauren
"I don’t want to impose." said by Phyllis
"Oh, come on." said by Lauren
"Don’t be ridiculous. What are friends for? Sit. Yeah." said by Michael
"Thank you." said by Phyllis
"You were on my list to call later." said by Lauren
"So, how are you today?" said by Michael
"Terrible. Terrible. Um, I can’t catch a break with my kids." said by Phyllis
"Oh. Are things still strained with summer?" said by Lauren
"Well, I mean, of course, because she fired me, so… but now there’s tension between me and daniel." said by Phyllis
"Oh, no. I thought everything was okay." said by Lauren
"What’s my crime? All I’m trying to do is help my kids. All I was trying to do with daniel is support his project and support something that was important to him." said by Phyllis
"Why am I sure there’s more to this?" said by Michael
"So, come on — tell me. How do you know tucker mccall is interested in daniel’s gaming platform?" said by Nate
"Because he’s the person I went to see earlier." said by Audra
"What?" said by Nate
"Tucker’s the one who texted, wanting to meet with me." said by Audra
"The personal business you said you had to handle." said by Nate
"Yes." said by Audra
"And when you got back, you were in a great mood. You know, someone else in my place might wonder if you’re working tucker… or me… or both of us. When a cold comes on strong," said by Nate
"Okay, well, what I’m about to tell you — it can’t leave this table." said by Phyllis
"Well, of course." said by Lauren
"Alright. Um, it seems that, uh, chancellor-winters may not be the home for my son’s new project." said by Phyllis
"You mean the gaming platform?" said by Lauren
"Yeah. It seems that chancellor-winters is in corporate limbo." said by Phyllis
"Oh. Well, I’m sorry to hear that." said by Michael
"Yeah, daniel must be so frustrated." said by Lauren
"Yeah. So I decided to be proactive and, um, shop the project around to see if I can get financial backing from another company, and, um, you know, just in case things at chancellor-winters imploded." said by Phyllis
"Wait. What? Without consulting daniel?" said by Lauren
"Why would you meddle with that?" said by Michael
"Well, I wasn’t meddling. It was just an exploratory conversation." said by Phyllis
"And you don’t think that’s overstepping just a wee bit?" said by Lauren
"Well, no, because daniel gave me the authority. I’m his right-hand man." said by Phyllis
"On the technical and staffing side so he could keep his eye on the big picture…" said by Michael
"Okay." said by Phyllis
"…Like deciding which company to choose to ally himself with." said by Michael
"Well, I just wanted to be proactive. I knew how important this project is to my son, but it has him doubting me again, so, i mean, I don’t know what to do. I can’t win. I mean, do I try too hard? I don’t get it." said by Phyllis
"Ohh, phyllis, i think there’s a common denominator with these problems with the children. Diane. Your intractable hostility towards her. It cost you your job at marchetti, and from what you’ve already told us, it’s creating friction between you and daniel." said by Michael
"Um, okay, diane has nothing to do with this issue right now with me and daniel. And I don’t want to get lectured about diane. Please." said by Phyllis
"Too bad." said by Lauren
"Just to calm your mind, I’ve taken into consideration how adam’s return would affect both victoria and nicholas. That’s why I want to find something for adam that he can run independent of them. That way, we all win." said by Victor
"[ Sighs ] I hate to see you make an enemy of jack again, not to mention tucker. And then you’ll be let down when adam rejects you again." said by Nikki
"You make that sound as if it is inevitable." said by Victor
"I believe that it is." said by Nikki
"No, it isn’T. I don’t think so. Adam will come to his senses. It’ll all work out as I have planned." said by Victor
"Well, I hope it does, for your sake." said by Nikki
"Now, there’s another issue we need to discuss, involving the break-in into our home in chicago." said by Victor
"Yeah. What about it?" said by Nikki
"Jack and diane jenkins were behind that, weren’t they? They stole your jewelry in order to set up that stark fellow. When were you gonna tell me?" said by Victor
"I was so upset when i realized what they had done. I was this close to telling chance that jack was the real culprit." said by

"Victoria, what have you done?" said by Nikki
"Done? Uh, I’ve done plenty. It’s been a very productive morning. Is there something in particular that you’re referring to?" said by Victoria
"I saw nicholas tearing out of here looking none too pleased. Wasn’t hard to guess what that was about." said by Nikki
"And you would be right." said by Victoria
"You asked him to take a leave from work, didn’t you?" said by Nikki
"It was more than just an ask." said by Victoria
"Oh, my god. Why would you do that? I told you it was a bad idea." said by Nikki
"It was the right thing to do." said by Victoria
"Hey, dr. Hastings, how are you? Oh. Sorry, it’s, uh, just mr. Hastings now, isn’t it?" said by Tucker
"Hello, tucker." said by Nate
"How’s the business world treating?" said by Tucker
"Great. Uh, I’m proud of quite a few new accomplishments I’ve managed to pull off at newman media. And I like to think I can take some credit for the increase in the profit margin as a result." said by Nate
"I’m sure audra charles could take some of that credit too, right?" said by Tucker
"Very. And now, she’s finally being given the opportunity to shine. I know exactly how that feels." said by Nate
"Oh, you mean after what happened to you at chancellor-winters?" said by Tucker
"I wasn’t treated right there. My ideas and opinions weren’t valued, and that was a– that was a frustrating experience. I get the feeling you clearly didn’t appreciate audra at your former company or she’d still be there." said by Nate
"Oh, I don’t know if I’d go that far." said by Tucker
"Yeah, right. Now, if you excuse me, I’ve got work to do." said by Nate
"Some work to do." said by Tucker
"Gotta hand it to you, nate." said by Nick
"Why is that?" said by Nate
"Pretty smooth, man. And you know exactly what I’m talking about." said by Nick
"Uh, can I get another one please? This could be interesting." said by Tucker
"Excuse me, nurse. Has miss spectra been released?" said by Adam
"No, she’s been taken for some final tests to be sure she’s ready for discharge." said by Nurse
"All right, so she could get out possibly today?" said by Adam
"What are you doing here, adam? Why do you keep coming back when I asked you to stay away?" said by Sally
"Please, sally, will you hear me out? Don’t push me away. Not now. Not after everything that has happened. (Smelling)" said by Adam
"Additional sponsorship provided by… with a smooth clean shave," said by Announcer
